byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ian Lovett from Los Angeles; Emily Palmer from New York; Matt Furber from Minneapolis; Conor Dougherty from Oakland, Calif.; and Stacey Solie from Seattle.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Hundreds of demonstrators calling for justice in shooting death of black teenager Laquan McDonald by white Chicago Police Officer Jason Van Dyke throng city's Norith Michgan Avenue, forcing closure of thoroughfare and some businesses on Black Friday, one of year's busiest shopping days; event is echoed by protests in other cities.
lead_paragraph: Demonstrators are demanding changes in the aftermath of the death of Laquan McDonald, a black 17-year-old, who was shot 16 times.

headline.main: Anger Over Killing by Police Halts Shopping in Chicago
headline.print_headline: Anger Over Killing by Police Halts Shopping in Chicago

snippet: Demonstrators are demanding changes in the aftermath of the death of Laquan McDonald, a black 17-year-old, who was shot 16 times.
